query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 Quando ambedue li figli di Latona, 2 coperti del Montone e de la Libra, 3 fanno de l’orizzonte insieme zona,
query.result: 1 When both the children of Latona, 2 covered by the Ram and the Scales, 3 make of the horizon a single zone,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 quant’ è dal punto che ’l cenìt inlibra 5 infin che l’uno e l’altro da quel cinto, 6 cambiando l’emisperio, si dilibra,
query.result: 4 as much as it is from the point where the zenith balances 5 until one and the other from that belt, 6 changing hemisphere, balances itself,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 tanto, col volto di riso dipinto, 8 si tacque Bëatrice, riguardando 9 fiso nel punto che m’avëa vinto.
query.result: 7 so much, with her face painted with laughter, 8 Beatrice was silent, gazing intently 9 at the point that had conquered me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Poi cominciò: «Io dico, e non dimando, 11 quel che tu vuoli udir, perch’ io l’ho visto 12 là ’ve s’appunta ogne ubi e ogne quando.
query.result: 10 Then she began: "I say, and do not ask, 11 what you want to hear, because I saw it 12 there where every where and every when is focused.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Non per aver a sé di bene acquisto, 14 ch’esser non può, ma perché suo splendore 15 potesse, risplendendo, dir “Subsisto”,
query.result: 13 Not to acquire good for itself, 14 which cannot be, but so that its splendor 15 could, by shining, say "I exist",

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 in sua etternità di tempo fore, 17 fuor d’ogne altro comprender, come i piacque, 18 s’aperse in nuovi amor l’etterno amore.
query.result: 16 in its eternity outside of time, 17 beyond all other comprehension, as it pleased it, 18 the eternal love opened itself in new loves.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 Né prima quasi torpente si giacque; 20 ché né prima né poscia procedette 21 lo discorrer di Dio sovra quest’ acque.

Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Forma e materia, congiunte e purette, 23 usciro ad esser che non avia fallo, 24 come d’arco tricordo tre saette.
query.result: 22 Form and matter, conjoined and pure, 23 came forth to be that which had no defect, 24 like three arrows from a three-stringed bow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 E come in vetro, in ambra o in cristallo 26 raggio resplende sì, che dal venire 27 a l’esser tutto non è intervallo,
query.result: 25 And as in glass, in amber, or in crystal 26 a ray shines so that between its coming 27 and its being there is no interval,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 così ’l triforme effetto del suo sire 29 ne l’esser suo raggiò insieme tutto 30 sanza distinzïone in essordire.
query.result: 28 so the threefold effect of its creator 29 in its being shone forth all at once 30 without distinction in its beginning.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Concreato fu ordine e costrutto 32 a le sustanze; e quelle furon cima 33 nel mondo in che puro atto fu produtto;

Please translate each line literally into English.
34 pura potenza tenne la parte ima; 35 nel mezzo strinse potenza con atto 36 tal vime, che già mai non si divima.

Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Ieronimo vi scrisse lungo tratto 38 di secoli de li angeli creati 39 anzi che l’altro mondo fosse fatto;

Please translate each line literally into English.
40 ma questo vero è scritto in molti lati 41 da li scrittor de lo Spirito Santo, 42 e tu te n’avvedrai se bene agguati;

Please translate each line literally into English.
43 e anche la ragione il vede alquanto, 44 che non concederebbe che ’ motori 45 sanza sua perfezion fosser cotanto.
query.result: 43 and reason also sees it to some extent, 44 for it would not allow that the movers 45 should be so much without their perfection.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 Or sai tu dove e quando questi amori 47 furon creati e come: sì che spenti 48 nel tuo disïo già son tre ardori.
query.result: 46 Now you know where and when these loves 47 were created and how: so that three fires 48 in your desire are already extinguished.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Né giugneriesi, numerando, al venti 50 sì tosto, come de li angeli parte 51 turbò il suggetto d’i vostri alimenti.
query.result: 49 Nor would you reach twenty, counting, 50 as quickly as a part of the angels 51 disturbed the matter of your nourishment.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
52 L’altra rimase, e cominciò quest’ arte 53 che tu discerni, con tanto diletto, 54 che mai da circüir non si diparte.
query.result: 52 The other remained, and began this art 53 that you discern, with so much delight, 54 that it never departs from circling.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Principio del cader fu il maladetto 56 superbir di colui che tu vedesti 57 da tutti i pesi del mondo costretto.
query.result: 55 The beginning of the fall was the cursed 56 pride of him whom you saw 57 weighed down by all the burdens of the world.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Quelli che vedi qui furon modesti 59 a riconoscer sé da la bontate 60 che li avea fatti a tanto intender presti:
query.result: 58 Those whom you see here were modest 59 in acknowledging themselves from the goodness 60 that had made them so quick to understand:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
61 per che le viste lor furo essaltate 62 con grazia illuminante e con lor merto, 63 si c’hanno ferma e piena volontate;

Please translate each line literally into English.
64 e non voglio che dubbi, ma sia certo, 65 che ricever la grazia è meritorio 66 secondo che l’affetto l’è aperto.
query.result: 64 and I do not want you to doubt, but be certain, 65 that receiving grace is meritorious 66 according to how open the affection is to it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
67 Omai dintorno a questo consistorio 68 puoi contemplare assai, se le parole 69 mie son ricolte, sanz’ altro aiutorio.
query.result: 67 Now around this consistory 68 you can contemplate much, if the words 69 of mine are understood, without other help.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
70 Ma perché ’n terra per le vostre scole 71 si legge che l’angelica natura 72 è tal, che ’ntende e si ricorda e vole,
query.result: 70 But because in your schools on earth 71 it is read that the angelic nature 72 is such that it understands, remembers, and wills,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
73 ancor dirò, perché tu veggi pura 74 la verità che là giù si confonde, 75 equivocando in sì fatta lettura.
query.result: 73 I will say more, so that you may see pure 74 the truth that is confused down there, 75 equivocating in such a reading.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Queste sustanze, poi che fur gioconde 77 de la faccia di Dio, non volser viso 78 da essa, da cui nulla si nasconde:
query.result: 76 These substances, after they were joyful 77 of the face of God, did not turn their face 78 from it, from which nothing is hidden:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 però non hanno vedere interciso 80 da novo obietto, e però non bisogna 81 rememorar per concetto diviso;

Please translate each line literally into English.
82 sì che là giù, non dormendo, si sogna, 83 credendo e non credendo dicer vero; 84 ma ne l’uno è più colpa e più vergogna.

Please translate each line literally into English.
85 Voi non andate giù per un sentiero 86 filosofando: tanto vi trasporta 87 l’amor de l’apparenza e ’l suo pensiero!
query.result: 85 You do not go down a single path 86 philosophizing: so much does 87 the love of appearance and its thought transport you!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
88 E ancor questo qua sù si comporta 89 con men disdegno che quando è posposta 90 la divina Scrittura o quando è torta.
query.result: 88 And even this up here is tolerated 89 with less disdain than when 90 the divine Scripture is neglected or twisted.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 Non vi si pensa quanto sangue costa 92 seminarla nel mondo e quanto piace 93 chi umilmente con essa s’accosta.
query.result: 91 You do not think how much blood it costs 92 to sow it in the world and how pleasing 93 is he who humbly approaches it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 Per apparer ciascun s’ingegna e face 95 sue invenzioni; e quelle son trascorse 96 da’ predicanti e ’l Vangelio si tace.
query.result: 94 To appear, each one exerts himself and makes 95 his own inventions; and those are run through 96 by the preachers and the Gospel is silent.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 Un dice che la luna si ritorse 98 ne la passion di Cristo e s’interpuose, 99 per che ’l lume del sol giù non si porse;

Please translate each line literally into English.
100 e mente, ché la luce si nascose 101 da sé: però a li Spani e a l’Indi 102 come a’ Giudei tale eclissi rispuose.
query.result: 100 and he lies, for the light hid itself 101 of its own accord: therefore to the Spanish and to the Indians 102 as to the Jews such an eclipse responded.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
103 Non ha Fiorenza tanti Lapi e Bindi 104 quante sì fatte favole per anno 105 in pergamo si gridan quinci e quindi:
query.result: 103 Florence does not have so many Lapis and Bindis 104 as such fables per year 105 are shouted from the pulpit here and there:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 sì che le pecorelle, che non sanno, 107 tornan del pasco pasciute di vento, 108 e non le scusa non veder lo danno.
query.result: 106 so that the little sheep, who do not know, 107 return from the pasture fed on wind, 108 and it is no excuse for them not to see the harm.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
112 e quel tanto sonò ne le sue guance, 113 sì ch’a pugnar per accender la fede 114 de l’Evangelio fero scudo e lance.
query.result: 112 and that resounded so much in their faces, 113 that to fight to kindle the faith 114 of the Gospel they made shield and lance.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
115 Ora si va con motti e con iscede 116 a predicare, e pur che ben si rida, 117 gonfia il cappuccio e più non si richiede.
query.result: 115 Now one goes with jokes and with witticisms 116 to preach, and as long as there is a good laugh, 117 the hood swells and nothing more is required.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
118 Ma tale uccel nel becchetto s’annida, 119 che se ’l vulgo il vedesse, vederebbe 120 la perdonanza di ch’el si confida:
query.result: 118 But such a bird nests in the little beak, 119 that if the common people saw it, they would see 120 the pardon in which they trust:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 per cui tanta stoltezza in terra crebbe, 122 che, sanza prova d’alcun testimonio, 123 ad ogne promession si correrebbe.
query.result: 121 because of which so much foolishness grew on earth, 122 that, without proof of any testimony, 123 one would run to every promise.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 Di questo ingrassa il porco sant’ Antonio, 125 e altri assai che sono ancor più porci, 126 pagando di moneta sanza conio.
query.result: 124 Saint Anthony the pig fattens on this, 125 and many others who are even more pigs, 126 paying with money without a stamp.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
127 Ma perché siam digressi assai, ritorci 128 li occhi oramai verso la dritta strada, 129 sì che la via col tempo si raccorci.
query.result: 127 But because we have digressed enough, turn 128 your eyes now toward the straight path, 129 so that the way may be shortened with time.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
130 Questa natura sì oltre s’ingrada 131 in numero, che mai non fu loquela 132 né concetto mortal che tanto vada;

Please translate each line literally into English.
133 e se tu guardi quel che si revela 134 per Danïel, vedrai che ’n sue migliaia 135 determinato numero si cela.
query.result: 133 and if you look at what is revealed 134 by Daniel, you will see that in his thousands 135 a definite number is concealed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
136 La prima luce, che tutta la raia, 137 per tanti modi in essa si recepe, 138 quanti son li splendori a chi s’appaia.
query.result: 136 The first light, which rays through it all, 137 is received in it in as many ways 138 as there are splendors to which it is joined.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
139 Onde, però che a l’atto che concepe 140 segue l’affetto, d’amar la dolcezza 141 diversamente in essa ferve e tepe.
query.result: 139 Whence, because the affection follows 140 the act that conceives, the sweetness of love 141 boils and burns in it differently.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
142 Vedi l’eccelso omai e la larghezza 143 de l’etterno valor, poscia che tanti 144 speculi fatti s’ha in che si spezza,
query.result: 142 See now the height and the breadth 143 of the eternal value, since it has made so many 144 mirrors in which it is broken,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
145 uno manendo in sé come davanti».
query.result: 145 remaining one in itself as before».
